title: Are we going to do something about Fiora, or is she going to be left to dominate?
body:
For real, passive does to much damage, Q is on too short of a cool down for her kit, parry is just broken in blocking damage/stuns and returning stuns, AA reset for split pushing and free crit, ult that deals a huge percent of true damage of enemy health while giving a huge heal if you get all four vitals

Too much, reduce please

here are possible solutions:

1- Make her Q reset CD only if she hits a vital, that way she has a window of weakness if you outmaneuver her
2- Remove the attack speed slow from her W, at least if she doesn't block a spell with it, she shouldn't be rewarded for being outplayed
3- Remove the MS slow from her E, she's mobile enough that she doesn't need it and it makes it impossible to play her vital game with her
4- Remove the movespeed she gets when she ults so she can't just cast it to run down immobile melees who become entirely helpless

You lost me when you used the word "Free" "Broken" "Huge" "Huge" explain to me, as a person who has never played as or against fiora, why she's so broken my good friend. Without using Hyperbole's(Exaggerating)

Her bullying is mainly Q spam on vitals. 

You're supposed to block it by walking behind minions, but when you do, due to her Q prioritizing champions, it still hits you through the waves.

Meaning, to fully avoid it, you have to completely avoid your own minions, and therefore, the enemy minions, denying you cs and xp.

Since FIora is meant to be a lategame hypercarry duelist/skirmisher, she should not be bullying or zoning champions in the early game.

She should be using her Q to last hit against most matchups, as opposed to poking/zoning/being aggressive.

She does have an attack speed slow, which have been removed from almost every updated or reworked champ. It's probably meant to encourage dueling, but is obnoxious nonetheless.

I'm pretty salty about this as a Trundle/Jax main but:

Her passive procs deal a lot of damage, especially when she builds AD, supplemented by the fact that they're true damage. They also give her fight sustain and immediate disengage/follow up with the MS boost. Also, having a .5 second refresh time, they're easy to follow up on.

Her Parry is pretty strong with negating abilities, though I personally don't think its too much of a problem. 

Her E with its auto-attack reset, slow, and crit upon next attack gives her a ton of dueling potential even if she isn't hitting Vitals, and makes it hard as hell to escape from her giving that she has another slow(potentially a stun), and constantly refreshing speed from Vitals and Phage passive.

Her ult lets her hit 4 vitals in rapid succession (or 5, because you can hit a Vital then ult immediately for the 4 vitals) and gives her a a massive heal field if certain conditions are met, which doesn't make much sense.

In terms of a skirmisher she's kinda silly. Every skirmisher (except Riven and maybe Ekko) has a weak early game into just about any matchup, but when she's put against a tank she becomes a GIGANTIC lane bully. Every skirmisher I'm aware of can't do anything nearly similar. This means she beats you in lane as a tank, and absolutely rends you mid and late game. (See Echo Fox vs FlyQuest Game 2, one of the shoutcasters even says Balls' Fiora was doing 64% max health true damage to Looper's Galio later on in the game, and calls her THE S class top laner right now, only maybe contested by Kennen.) 

She also has an unparalleled 1v1 game against other hypercarries due to the fact that she has a cripple on her W, meaning that that her splitpush is UNHOLY. Going back the the same Echo Vs Fly game, Balls nearly carries his team on it, being able to just shove the lane with Ravenous, sustain Looper's damage, and just mash their turrets with her high AD+E with Balls hounding on her. At one point Balls even 100-30's Looper after not taking some turret shots + a Galio Q.

Going back the the same Echo Vs Fly game, Balls nearly carries his team on it, being able to just shove the lane with Ravenous, sustain Looper's damage, and just mash their turrets with her high AD+E with Balls hounding on her. At one point Balls even 100-30's Looper after not taking some turret shots + a Galio Q.

Galio should've bullied Fiora out early game - I'm not sure who the junglers were, but they should've kept vision up top lane so Galio could play aggressive. Galio is much stronger than Fiora early game, and will only lose a duel if Fiora ults. But he can easily bully out Fiora with Q's.

Also, you haven't mentioned her weaknesses. Most major of which being her incredibly low range and bad gapcloser, meaning she is completely ineffective against the backline.
I don't 100% disagree on most of your counterpoints, the point here was to state why she's strong. The thing is, most of her strengths heavily outweighs her weaknesses at the moment.

Her W has to hit you for it to slow you/your attack speed, move to the side. The reason a Fiora uses a W is to try to predict your CC or try to slow you. You cant complain about her W much because its a prediction on her part as well. if she misses it or wastes it, that's a good 16+s of downtime for you to punish her. She's a very antinoob champion in the sense that you cant just spam your abilities or fight her however/whenever you want, shes an engaging champion to play against.

Its not about not letting her Qs hit you, its about playing around that. You know she's gonna do it if you have a frontal vital, play the game and F her up. The damage is meh early game, shes not nearly as bad as she used to be. 

Another point about the W, is if its blocking an exhaust/ignite then that's borderline your own damn vault, aside from the initial start of the W its very telegraphed. If you used it right as she cast it, then its her making a prediction.
When you play Fiora, you get a "feel" for when things are gonna happen. And obviously you'll be wrong sometimes but if you're on top of someone, they're not focusing on outplaying you, but not dying/stopping you. They panic rather than calm down and because of that they get outplayed.

For example there was a game where I denied malz his ult on me 3 times in a row, because each time I jumped on him was under his tower.  1 Q, used one E, used my hydra and Parried. Which was precisely the time he used ult. the third time I used parry immediately after I used Q because I figured he wouldn't try to hold his ult that time, and I was right again. Its a mechanic that rewards for prediction and punishes poor players.
If I stand against a wall I'm immobile, it's hard to miss her W on a melee champ. Her Q doesn't do much but a vital sure does, and Q aims for them.

EDIT: Not even considering the extra 20-40 damage per proc of Tiamat from those 5 autos AND her Q

Instead of "hurr she strong nerf", instead play around with plausible changes.

Passive: Unlike most people I find it's mostly fine. It could do with having a slightly longer amount of time before reapplying a vital during the earlier stages of the game.

Q: Needs to be **_rewarded for only proccing vitals_** if it's to keep the very generous prioritising of them, and more _**punished if not**_. An overall CD reduction, but with the cooldown refund only applying to vitals would be much fairer to play against. 

For example - Currently Lv 1 Q is a 16 second cooldown, reduced by 60% (to 6.4 seconds) for hitting anything.
It could be changed to a 12 second cooldown, reduced by 60% (to 5.2 seconds) only when hitting vitals.

W: Reduce it's duration to 0.5s. If it's going to have such high counter/outplay potential, it should have a short duration to really test timing/skill. Also reduce or remove the attack speed slow. 

E: No problems with her E.

R: No problems with her R.

Hitting one or more of these problems can put her in a healthier spot, without just simply removing damage (which is usually, in my eyes, the laziest method).
